commander.name: Alfred Reade Godwin-Austen
commander.notes: Succeeded Lt-Gen Beresford-Peirse in August 1941. Previously Western Desert Force, redesignated XIII Corps September 1941.

Valentine II/IV Infantry Tank.notes: New equipment, combat debut at Crusader

tanks.notes: 1st Army Tank Brigade attached to XIII Corps. 130 infantry tanks total, mostly Matildas with some Valentines.

halftracks.notes: British Commonwealth forces did not employ halftracks. Universal Carriers used instead.

Ordnance QF 25-pounder.notes: 2nd NZ Division Artillery (72), 4th Indian Division Artillery (72)

fighters.notes: Air support provided by RAF Desert Air Force, not organic to corps

supply_logistics.supply_status: Good. Corps forming/reorganizing during Q3 1941. Based in Egypt with excellent supply lines from Alexandria and Cairo. 2nd NZ Division rebuilding after Greece/Crete. Preparing for Operation Crusader offensive (November 1941). Water, fuel, and ammunition stocks being built up for major offensive operations.
supply_logistics.notes: Corps-level supply depots being established. Royal Navy control of Mediterranean ensures resupply. Desert warfare logistics emphasized - water, fuel, vehicle maintenance critical.

weather_environment.terrain_type: Coastal Western Desert - gravel plains, escarpments, wadis
weather_environment.notes: Hot Egyptian summer transitioning to fall. Dust storms occasional. Terrain suitable for mobile operations. Limited water sources - all water trucked from Nile Delta.

subordinate_units.notes: In Maadi Camp, Egypt. Training and reequipping Q3 1941.
Veteran division from East Africa campaign. Assigned to XIII Corps for Operation Crusader.

subordinate_units.equipment: 130 infantry tanks (98 Matilda II, 32 Valentine II/IV)
subordinate_units.notes: Attached to XIII Corps for infantry support. Valentines combat debut at Crusader.
Corps-level support units including medium artillery, engineers, signals, logistics.

tactical_doctrine.role: Infantry corps for breakthrough and exploitation operations in desert warfare
special_capabilities: Mobile operations in open desert terrain
known_issues: 2-pounder AT guns inadequate vs Panzer III/IV
Matilda tanks slow (15 mph) - cannot exploit breakthroughs
Limited anti-tank firepower at corps level
2nd NZ Division still rebuilding from Crete losses
Coordination challenges between infantry and armor
Water logistics critical constraint in desert
tactical_doctrine.desert_adaptations: Corps optimized for Western Desert operations. Vehicle maintenance for sand/dust emphasized. Water discipline critical - all units trained in desert survival. Navigation training for featureless terrain. Combined arms doctrine integrating infantry divisions with attached tank brigades.

scenario_suitability: Infantry breakthrough with tank support scenarios
special_rules: Desert Veterans: 4th Indian Division +1 to desert operations
New Zealand Aggression: 2nd NZ Division +1 to assault actions
Infantry Tank Support: 1st Army Tank Brigade provides breakthrough capability
Commonwealth Coordination: Multi-national corps, -1 to coordination on first turn
Matilda Armor: Very tough armor but slow speed limits exploitation

source: Web search results: XIII Corps formation September 1941 (Tier 2, 80% confidence)
Military Wiki: XIII Corps composition (Tier 2, 75% confidence)
1st Army Tank Brigade at Crusader (Tier 2, 80% confidence)
British Army Lists July-October 1941 - Godwin-Austen appointment (Tier 1, 90% confidence)
validation.validated_by: Claude Code - Manual extraction from historical sources
known_gaps: 4th Indian Division not available in Q3 files - estimated from Q2 baseline
Corps troops strength estimated from standard British corps establishment
Exact dates within Q3 for corps formation (September 1941 confirmed)
Vehicle distribution estimated from divisional aggregates
notes: XIII Corps formed September 1941 by redesignating Western Desert Force
Part of newly-formed Eighth Army under General Alan Cunningham
Corps prepared for Operation Crusader (November 1941) during Q3
1st Army Tank Brigade: 130 infantry tanks confirmed from multiple sources
Personnel totals estimated: 20,000 (2nd NZ) + 15,000 (4th Indian) + 2,200 (1st Tank) + 7,800 (corps troops) = 45,000
Tank totals validated: 130 = 0 heavy + 0 medium + 130 light (Matilda/Valentine classified as infantry tanks)
